TopicTitle: Just found some awesome way to land on low-g worlds with KAS

Articles.Content:
I'm feeling dumb right now because I have no idea WHY didn't I think of that earlier. It's fairly obvious, after all. I've been using KAS for months and 'invented' this simple solution only just now.

Here, just fire these hooks at touch down, no matter how unstable your station is now it's safe and secure:

![aHLw9Rw.png](http://i.imgur.com/aHLw9Rw.png)

Wow...that is TRULY creative! As a fellow KAS user...I commend you for that idea! Have some rep!

It's the Philae way, right?

Pretty awesome.

Seems legit.

Could probably be used on any moon, especially if the ship is tall.

I mean, we use it for towers, right?

> 
> It's the Philae way, right?
> Pretty awesome.

Exactly what I wanted to say!

BTW, It looks very cool.
has anyone tried the claw?
The claw only works with craft and asteroids. No chance to grab landscape.
I've used the grappling hook to anchor cranes to the ground, I'd never thought of using it to anchor a lander. nice 1!

Just like they did for the movie Deep Impact. They tethered onto the comet.

![deepimpact014.jpg](http://www.scifimoviezone.com/imageapocascifi/deepimpact014.jpg)

Brilliant, the good old shark fisherman's solution. However, accidentally retracting the cables might crush your lander. Would it be possible to grapple onto the underside of, say, one of the arches in the R&D Facility?
I should probably add that they can also save you when landing on a slope.

How do you "fire" the cables?
Squad should make fuel pipes stock, the other KAS stuff is really useful but pipes are probably the most useful.

> 
> How do you "fire" the cables?

If you have the claw-part (I forget the name; shown in the OP screenshot) attached, "eject" should cause it to shoot out and grab the nearest thing in front of it.
